Reviews.Title: “Warm Pool Was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Trish246
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom unit with my husband, father and 12yr old son. Great layout for our family. Son slept on the hide-a-bed and my father had his own room and bathroom. Newly remodeled rooms had nice decor. A tiny bit of wear and tear was starting to show already on some wood edges here and there, but very minimal. Very clean. Great to have a nice kitchen. We stocked up on snacks at a local Walmart and also used the fridge and microwave for leftovers from a nice dinner out. This was our home base for 3 nights while visiting Legoland and Sea World. Great freeway access and within a decent driving distance. It was about 35 minutes to Legoland and about 22 minutes to Sea World. There are a number of restaurants within walking distance and the buffet breakfast at the hotel was really nice with a good variety and late enough hours that we didn't have to get up at the crack of dawn while on vacation. I think it went until 9:30am on weekdays and 10:00am on the weekend. The best part of our stay was the pool though. The weather wasn't as nice as we were hoping it would be while in San Diego. Low 60's and some rain, but the pool was so nice and warm that we could still swim... even in the evening. It made it feel like a vacation despite the cold weather. My only complaints were that we were "offered" two separate rooms when we arrived instead of the two bedroom suite we had reserved. I explained that the two bedroom suite was the entire reason I chose this hotel. Rather than making me feel like keeping my reservation was OK, I was told about how sometimes those rooms are overbooked, etc, etc and ended up feeling like I was inconveniencing them even though they were able to honor our reservation. I also had an extra double charge on my credit card for one night that I discovered after I got home, and they didn't apply my Marriott rewards nights correctly. With that said, I would totally stay here again. It was like home away from home. The 12:00 checkout was great too. That extra hour is really nice...even if you don't need it. It is just nice to not feel rushed out.

Reviews.Title: “New, Clean, Spacious, Comfortable and Pet Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Exploring4Fun
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel; everything seems new and in great condition and good location. We were upgraded to a 2-bedroom upon arrival, which was wonderful since we were traveling with a 10 year-old and a dog. The suite was nicely arranged, 3 televisions throughout, a nice kitchen, spacious living area. The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms were great and it was very clean. The only downsides was breakfast provided plastic utensils and the coffee was not so good. Also, we could hear water running in a pipe through a bedroom wall...seemed like it was running all night long. But would definately recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Family Vacation and Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: RozeroniandSkyguy
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage granddaughter and I stayed here for 6 nights while visiting family in Escondido. This hotel provided everything we needed for a relaxing vacation in the San Diego area. The location was perfect for us! It is half way between San Diego and Escondido with easy access to the freeway. We were able to move around the area quite easily. It is also just a short drive to southern CA's beautiful beaches. Our room was spacious and extremely clean. It had two big windows that provided a feeling of "openness" which is sometimes lost in a hotel room. We had a fully equipped kitchen and a pull out sofa bed in addition to a comfortable king bed and vanity sink outside the bathroom. The breakfast area had a homey feel and was beautifully maintained by the staff. There is comfortable seating, a big screen TV and free use of a computer and printer. Breakfast consisted of a variety of hot and cold items that changed day to day as well as the ever present large bowls of fresh fruit. We were delighted to find a delicious hot meal of lasagna, garlic bread, crisp salad, soft drinks, beer and wine when we arrived hungry and tired after traveling all day from the East Coast. Guests can enjoy complimentary dinner nightly Monday thru Thursday. All outside areas are clean and well cared for and there is plenty of free parking. There is a large gas grill, tables with umbrellas and a heated pool and hot tub. Right next door is a restaurant/cocktail lounge that serves delicious seafood, salads and sandwiches. Within the complex there is a gas station/convenience store and fast food restaurant. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. I definitely recommend this hotel to business travelers as well as family vacationers. It has everything you need at a affordable price. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great long-term comfort”
Reviews.Author: RickD74
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice for extended periods and have enjoyed our stays. Staff is very friendly and the rooms were completed updated last summer. Pool is heated and breakfast and evening snacks have been great! Love the burger and hotdog night! Your pets are allowed as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cris_C_0316
Reviews.Content: Whether you are on a business trip or visiting San Diego for pleasure the Residence Inn at Scripps Poway is an excellent choice. I have been on an extended business stay in San Diego since September and this hotel is my home away from home. The front desk staff really makes an effort to get to know you and make you feel welcome. It is nice to have a smiling face greet you (by name) after a long day at work. When I return after a weekend or week long trip back home (Florida) I am greeted by name and "It's so good to have you with us again." The morning breakfast is very good and has a variety of items to choose from, the ladies working the dining area always smile and asks if there is anything that I need. I will thank them for their service and many times I am told "oh no, the pleasure is ours and thank you for choosing to stay with us." There is a small dinner that is served Monday - Thursday which is good if you don't feel like going out anywheres. Wednesday night is "Manager" night and they always grill out hamburgers, hot dogs and chicken. Trent the General Manager is on hand and walks around to talk to everyone and checks to make sure that you are satisfied or what he or his staff can do to make your stay more enjoyable. The housekeepers do an excellent job as my room is always clean. They have even put my dishes away after being washed in the dishwasher so I don't have to contend with that after working all day. I would recommend the Residence Inn to anyone who is visiting the area and if I ever have to return on business again or for pleasure this will be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMapper
Reviews.Content: Pretty small hotel and not too close to anything but really convienient to lots of things. New and fresh inside.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! Great place for business travelers or family in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Patrick H
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this Residence since 2006 - about 45-60 days a year on average. It is about 20 minutes from the airport and not close to downtown. However, this is a plus because it is close by without being stuck in the middle of the traffic and high prices found downtown. It is situated right off I-15 with easy access to MCAS Miramar, restaurants, shopping, running areas, horse riding, bicycling, etc. The hotel recently underwent a remodeling that enlarged the dining area (complimentary breakfast and manager's special evening meals (Mon-Thurs) and updated the entire interior. Very nicely furnished rooms with dedicated desk with free fast internet (wired and wireless), dining table, full refrigerator/freezer, and cooktop. The views are nothing special but service is outstanding - friendly, professional and helpful. This is by far my favorite place to stay in San Diego. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, county centrally located with a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lost_bobcat
Reviews.Content: I used a free marriot reward nite at this residence inn. It is central to a lot of business in the rancho bernardo, scripps ranch, mira mesa and only 20 minutes from downtown and the airport. You need a car to get to places, but the hotel is a typical Residence Inn, very new and clean and right on the freeway, two restaurants and 1 fast food in walking distance. The staff was very helpful, the breafast great, had a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: scotland1932
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed at. Hotel and staff were excellent and no problem about having my pets with me. Great location and almost every night they have a meal option right onsite. Great rooms and location. Would definatley stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Constance and J... S
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and daughter-in-law stayed at the Residence Inn San Diego Scripps Poway Parkway, at the suggestion of our other son and daughter-in-law who live in San Diego. It was a wonderful place in which to stay. The enterior is lovely and comfortable. The people are all friendly and helpful. They all made our stay so enjoyable. The breakfast and dinner in the evening was wonderful and plentiful. We loved our suite and it provided plenty of room and privacy. They even offer reduced rates on tickets for the San Diego Zoo, which we absolutely loved. The people who work here really appear to love their jobs and everyone is smiling and always in a good mood. The gal at the reception desk even came to our aid when we had a problem with the interior lights on our rental car. We highly recommend this place and look forward to returning the next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great value”
Reviews.Author: Jonavin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in July. Rooms are newly renovated and beautiful suites with LCD TV, free internet, breakfast, parking and happy hour. If I had to complain it would be that rooms facing the main road could be noisy early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectation”
Reviews.Author: One_fly
Reviews.Content: Has everything you would need. Although a little far from every where in San diego, it is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, secure comfort with perfect service”
Reviews.Author: SciHound
Reviews.Content: Whether you're with family or friends this place is set up to deliver living quarters that are clean, comfortable and have everything you need to set yourself up a home from home. The kitchen's are wonderful, the bathrooms spacious and the living quarters set out beautifully. The facilities are fabulous with everything you might expect from a hotel plus that little bit extra that makes you feel like you're getting true, quality service and value for money. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment, then when our male friend left, we moved to a one bed with sofa bed in the living room. Both suites exeeding expectations, the second being simply a smaller version of the first. Even as two ladies alone, we feel safe, secure and well looked after here. The complimentary food is better than one might expect and the servce is impeccable. The cleaning staff are superb and reception make us feel we are the most important people on the planet whenever we speak to them. Thoroughly enjoying our stay here still and would recommend this place to anyone. You will need a car to get into the city but where don't you in the US? To be honest, the open skies that are found out here a little way out of the city are worth the extra few minutes of petrol and we are quickly discovering that the coutryside, deserts, forests and lakes are pulling us even more than San Diego itself. So, this location is a perfect compromise and a lot more peaceful than the inner city hotel we first looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CycloneWellywood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of days to cover Seaworld & Legoland. Quite a comfy hotel & nice beds. The hotel has free breakfast included which is unlimited & filling. You can easily get past lunchtime with a big breakfast. Only downside is that the hotel is just off the highway & not many eating places close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is so sweet”
Reviews.Author: susansba
Reviews.Content: Not only did I get a splendid price on Priceline, the hotel was a real treasure in ammenities and location. The room/studio was extremely clean, quiet and well appointed wit most pleasant furnishings and a very functional kitchenett with cooking and dining supplies. The buffet breakfast was such a bonus as we like a good lumberjack breakfast when on vacation. The attendants greeted us with sincere welcomes as if we were special guests at their own home. More than splendid treatment and a huge buffet that even had rice and oatmeal with three different entres each day. Pool and spa on site. Three restaurants in walking distance and freeway close. Highly enjoyable and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: PageantGuru
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at this Residence Inn previously, and stayed again in September. The hotel is excellent for both travel and leisure. Love the location. Very nice pool and very accommodating front desk staff. Nice restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive. Well managed, clean and spacious. Impressive stay.”
Reviews.Author: previewfirst
Reviews.Content: Contractors working on house = Hotel for the week. We had a two bedroom suite on the second floor for only $169/night. Service was excellent. Three kids loved the breakfast buffet every morning. Coffee great, and Starbucks close by. Close freeway access. I live 4 miles away, but for those visiting San Diego with family, it's an ideal location for several reasons. While it's Inland by 15 minutes, it's situated close to the freeway, and in the middle of everything you might want to do. Only 15 min from downtown, 15 minutes from beach, 20 minutes from Wild Animal Park, 15 minutes from San Diego zoo, 30 minutes from Lego Land. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but you gotta like dogs”
Reviews.Author: MaxBoris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Very nice room - 1 bedroom with sleeper sofa and kitchen. The place had a full sized refrigerator, stove, kitchen ware, coffee maker. Room was good sized, very clean. Place was pleasant. The only thing was the sofa bed was a bit saggy and the regular bed was a bit on the hard side (I like a softer sleep). Because my husband snores, he ended up on the sofa bed and it wasn't very comfortable. The breakfast was great - hot food that included eggs, pancakes, waffles as well as oatmeal, cereal, bagels, yogurt, and fruit. We saw at least 6 people with dogs and one morning we heard a dog barking (room next door?). Location is about 30 minutes to Legoland and 20 minutes to Seaworld. We were there for vacation and hockey tournament, only 5 minutes from San Diego ice rink.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: TravelerG8
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience with location outside the San Diego congestion. Had a two bedroom suite which slept the extended family. Breakfast was great with eggs, sausage, waffles, and other options. Wish we would have been there on a weekday to take advantage of the complimentary happy hour also. Recommend it highly. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a highway view”
Reviews.Author: azrin74
Reviews.Content: Very nice big spacious hotel. On top of a hilly area.... Ample parking space.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lori11111
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year old son, 5 month old son, my sister-in-law, & I all stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in a 2 bedroom/2bathroom suite while vacationing in southern California. We stayed in 2 other Residence Inns also during our vacation as we traveled around & this one by far was the nicest. It was very clean and looked very well maintained. The front desk staff was friendly. Laundry rooms cleaned & laundry supplies given out at front desk. The breakfast buffet was OUTSTANDING. Always maintained. No sooner one item ran out...the staff was behind it replacing it. Tables were constantly wiped off & it was not just a continental breakfast. There was eggs, sausage, waffles, juices, donuts, etc. You had a lot to choose from. The only disappointment we had was that our 4 year old spilled a glass of chocolate milk on his sheets and blanket for the sofa bed he was sleeping in. We left them for the maid in the morning "assuming" they would be replaced...they weren't. When we called down front desk staff said they would take care of it right away...and immediately someone brought the sheets. Which was great...but no blanket. We had to place a call 2 more times that night because no blanket showed up...and actually the blanket didn't come till the next morning. But overall the service & the cleanliness was superb...keeping up with the Marriott standards. We would definitely stay here again. About 20 minutes from San Diego Zoo & about 30 minutes from Legoland ... A chili's in walking distance ...and a nice pool area...though it was too cold for us to use...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic extended stay with our pets!”
Reviews.Author: travlingal05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this particular Residence Inn for two weeks in July 2006. As we were in the process of moving, we had our pets with us and the fact that they were able to stay here was a big plus. The hotel is located approximately 20 minutes from downtown San Diego and its attractions. We made the trip almost daily and only hit traffic during weekday rush hour. If you can avoid these times, you'll barely notice that you're not in San Diego proper... except for the fact that it is significantly hotter. Temps average 15 degrees higher here, but rooms are climate controlled by the guests with a digital thermostat that kept us sufficiently cool. Additionally, the pool was refreshing and virtually empty during the day. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and were pleasantly surprised by its size. The hotel offers studios and two bedroom suites, but I'd recommend the one bedroom over the studio for extended stay guests using the kitchen. Who wants to cook in their bedroom?! The kitchen was equipped with pots, plates, glasses, and various utentils. Dishwasher with detergent provided. No oven, but a small two-burner electric cooktop and a large microwave, plus a full-sized fridge. Breakfast was substantial (eggs, potatos, breakfast meat, pancakes/french toast, waffle maker, plus the continental breakfast options). Light dinner was served Monday-Thursday and included salad, beer, wine, sodas, and bread plus the "main course". During our stay, the main course ranged from buffalo chicken strips to hamburges and hotdogs to spaghetti and meatballs. Service was excellent. All hotel employees were polite and helpful. Parking was generally good; on one occasion we had to park in a lot that seemed to be shared with the other Mariott hotel in this plaza, Springhill Suites. In the plaza there is also a Chilis and a local seafood restaurant as well as a Wendys. There is a grocery store nearby and if you need them to, the hotel staff will shop for you. My main criticisms of this property were the lack of wireless internet in the rooms (they do have ethernet hookups in the rooms and wireless in the lobby/tv area) and the limited TV channels. Normally I wouldn't care, but since we were staying for two weeks, a greater selection of "non-news" channels would have been great! Overall, a lovely pet-friendly property with helpful, service-oriented staff. We'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn--my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this particular Residence Inn from June 25th thru June 28th 2005, during our recent trip to Southern California. We had a two bedroom, two bathroom suite and were lucky enough to be on the same floor as the laundry room. The unit had a FULL kitchen, three TVs and internet access. I was even surprised to see that the staff would do your grocery shopping for you if you so desired. We did not take them up on their offer--as we were only there for a short time and did not plan to do any serious cooking. This hotel offered an above average continental breakfast. You could fix waffles and customize your scrambled eggs. The breakfast room was cozy and even though it was summer time, the fireplace was on to take the chill off. On weekday evenings, the hotel offers a light supper. We were only there for one weekday evening, during which they served lasagna, which was pretty good. My kids enjoyed playing basketball at the court and swimming in the pool. The only "complaint" that I had about the hotel was that the mattress in the master bedroom was too soft. I prefer a more firmer mattress. But we did have more than enough blankets, pillows and towels during our stay. We were about less than 30 minutes away from SeaWorld and the Zoo--which was okay for us. It gave us a chance to see the Northern section of San Diego. All in all, it was a very clean hotel, with excellent amenities and excellent service. I would definitely stay here again if I am in the area and I would recommend this hotel to others.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn San Diego Scripps Poway Parkway
HotelInfo.Address: 12011 Scripps Highlands Dr, & Scripps Poway Pkwy, San Diego, CA 92131
